properties.description: The insertion point before the table in the story containing the table.
properties.name: storyOffset

properties.description: The story that contains the text.
properties.name: parentStory

properties.description: The text content or page item referred to by the element. Can return: Text, Story, PageItem, Movie, Sound, Graphic, Table or Cell.
properties.name: xmlContent

properties.description: The unique ID of the XMLElement.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.
properties.name: isValid

properties.description: The parent of the XMLElement (a Document or XMLElement).
properties.name: parent

properties.description: The index of the XMLElement within its containing object.
properties.name: index

properties.description: The page items collection, which can be used to process all page items in a container (such as a document, page, or group), regardless of type.
properties.name: pageItems

properties.description: A collection of bitmap images in any bitmap file format (including TIFF, JPEG, or GIF).
properties.name: images

properties.description: A collection of imported graphics in any graphic file format (vector, metafile, or bitmap).
properties.name: graphics

properties.description: A collection of text style ranges.
properties.name: textStyleRanges

properties.description: The XML tag applied to the element. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: markupTag

properties.description: The contents of the text. Can return: String or SpecialCharacters enumerator.
properties.name: contents

properties.description: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.
properties.name: properties

methods.description: Moves the element to the specified location.

parameters.description: The location in relation to the reference object or within the containing object.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: The reference object. Note: Required when the to parameter specifies before or after. . Can accept: XMLItem or Text. (Optional)
parameters.name: reference

methods.name: move

methods.description: Duplicates the XMLElement.
methods.name: duplicate

methods.description: Associates the object with the specified XML element while preserving existing content.

parameters.description: The object to mark up. Can accept: PageItem, Movie, Sound, Graphic, Story, Text or Table.
parameters.name: using

methods.name: markup

methods.description: Places XML content into the story, replacing the existing content.

parameters.description: The object to place into. Can accept: Story, PageItem, Graphic, Movie or Sound.
parameters.name: using

methods.name: placeXML

methods.description: Untags an element.
methods.name: untag

methods.description: Validates the element against a DTD.

parameters.name: maximumErrors
parameters.description: The maximum number of validation errors to generate. (Optional)

methods.name: validate

methods.description: Applies the specified paragraph style to the text content of the XMLElement.

parameters.description: The paragraph style to apply. Can accept: String or ParagraphStyle.
parameters.name: using
clearingOverrides
parameters.description: If true, clears any attributes before applying the style. (Optional)

methods.name: applyParagraphStyle

methods.description: Applies the specified character style to the text content of the XMLElement.

parameters.description: The character style to apply. Can accept: String or CharacterStyle.
parameters.name: using

methods.name: applyCharacterStyle

methods.description: Converts the XMLElement to an attribute of its parent element.

parameters.description: The name to give to the new attribute. (Optional)
parameters.name: using

methods.name: convertToAttribute

methods.description: Converts the content of the XML element to a table.

parameters.description: The XML tag that indicates a table row.
parameters.name: rowTag

parameters.description: The XML tag that indicates a table cell.
parameters.name: cellTag

methods.name: convertElementToTable

methods.description: Places an XML element into an inline frame.

parameters.description: The dimensions of the inline frame in the format [width, height].
parameters.name: dimensions

methods.name: placeIntoInlineFrame

methods.description: Associates an existing page item with the XML element and places it into an inline frame.

parameters.description: The page item to copy.
parameters.name: copyItem
retainExistingFrame
parameters.description: If true, moves the existing page item. If false, moves a copy of the page item. (Optional)

methods.name: placeIntoInlineCopy

methods.description: Replaces the content of XML element with content imported from a file.

parameters.description: The file path to the import file.
parameters.name: using

parameters.description: Base path used to resolve relative paths. (Optional)
parameters.name: relativeBasePath

methods.name: setContent

methods.description: Inserts the specified text as content before, in, or after the XML element.

parameters.description: The text to be inserted. Can accept: String or SpecialCharacters enumerator.
parameters.name: using

parameters.description: The position at which to insert the text. Note that text inserted before or after the element does not become part of the content of the element. Instead, it becomes content of the parent of the element.
parameters.name: position

methods.name: insertTextAsContent

methods.description: Applies a table style to the table associated with the XMLElement.

parameters.description: The table style to apply. Can accept: String or TableStyle.
parameters.name: using
clearingOverrides
parameters.description: If true, removes local formatting before applying the table style. (Optional)

methods.name: applyTableStyle

methods.description: Applies a cell style to the table cells associated with the XMLElement.

parameters.description: The cell style to apply. Can accept: String or CellStyle.
parameters.name: using
clearingOverrides
parameters.description: If true, removes local formatting before applying the cell style. (Optional)

methods.name: applyCellStyle

methods.description: Applies an object style to the frame associated with the XMLElement.

parameters.description: The object style to apply. Can accept: String or ObjectStyle.
parameters.name: using
clearingOverrides
parameters.description: If true, removes local formatting before applying the object style. (Optional)

parameters.name: clearingOverridesThroughRootObjectStyle
parameters.description: If true, clears unchecked category attributes through the root style. (Optional)

methods.name: applyObjectStyle

methods.description: Places the XML element into a new rectangular page item. If the XML element was already associated with a page item, that page item is deleted.

parameters.description: The page or spread on which to create the new page item. Can accept: Spread, Page or MasterSpread.
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: The bounds of the page item excluding the stroke width, in the format [y1, x1, y2, x2].
parameters.name: geometricBounds

methods.name: placeIntoFrame

methods.description: Associates the XML element with a copy of a page item.

parameters.description: The page or spread on which to create the new page item. Can accept: Spread, Page or MasterSpread.
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: The page coordinates of the top left corner of the page item, in the format [y1, x1]
parameters.name: placePoint

parameters.description: The page item to copy.
parameters.name: copyItem
retainExistingFrame
parameters.description: If true, associates the XML element with the existing page item and moves the page item (rather than a copy of the page item). (Optional)

methods.name: placeIntoCopy

methods.description: Imports the specified XML file into an InDesign document.

parameters.description: The XML file.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: The namespace mapping table. Can accept: Array of Arrays of 2 Strings. (Optional)
parameters.name: prefixMappingTable

methods.name: evaluateXPathExpression

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)

forceSave
parameters.description: If true, forcibly saves a version. (Optional)
